image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives, Gift of Jim Oliver

profileText: A Representative from New York; born in Nassau, Rensselaer County, N.Y., November 11, 1822; received an academic training; engaged in mercantile pursuits and in steel manufacture; mayor of Troy in 1855; engaged in banking and also served as president of the Troy & Lansingburgh Railroad Co., of the Troy & Cohoes Railroad Co., and of the New Orleans, Mobile & Texas Railroad Co.; was an unsuccessful candidate for election in 1860 to the Thirty-seventh Congress; elected as a Democrat to the Thirty-eighth Congress (March 4, 1863-March 3, 1865); reelected as a Republican to the Thirty-ninth and Fortieth Congresses (March 4, 1865-March 3, 1869); was not a candidate for renomination in 1868 but was an unsuccessful Republican candidate for Governor of New York; elected regent of the University of the State of New York April 29, 1869; died in Troy, N.Y., on October 31, 1872; interment in Oakwood Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: In the John Ericsson Papers, ca. 1821-1890, 4.4 linear feet.
1860-1869. 24 letters.
researchRecord.description: Personal and business correspondence. Finding aid in repository.

researchRecord.name: ca. 1837-1895. 8 feet (3,450 items).
researchRecord.description: Business papers, political correspondence, and patent applications. Unpublished finding aid in repository.

researchRecord.name: In the Edwin Morgan Papers, ca. 1838-1883, approximately 50 cubic feet.
1858, 1 page.
researchRecord.description: A letter from John Augustus Griswold to Major Mordecai written on September 17, 1858. In the letter, Griswold in regards to cast iron patterns used in a blacksmith shop.

researchRecord.name: In the Selected Civil War Collections held by the New York State Library, ca. 1860-1898, amount unknown.
